title: 5 free agents that might make the most sense for Patriots to pursue at positions of need
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The New England Patriots have approximately $41 million in cap space this offseason.
Potential free agent targets include Colts WR Alec Pierce and Packers OT Rasheed Walker.
Ravens C Connor McGovern and TE Isaiah Likely also could be valuable additions for the Patriots.

title: Making some sense of the new ESPN/MLB.TV streaming partnership and what it means to fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: ESPN partners with MLB.TV for streaming, offering it as a $134.99 season add-on to ESPN Unlimited subscribers.
Non-ESPN Unlimited subscribers can buy MLB.TV for $149.99, including a free month of ESPN Unlimited, auto-renewing at $29.99/month.
Existing MLB.TV users can continue their subscription via their account, with optional ESPN Unlimited free trial available.

title: ‘We’re real excited’: Celtics’ Ron Harper Jr. shares Jayson Tatum looked like himself in recent G League practice
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Ron Harper Jr. noted Jayson Tatum looked like himself during practice with the Maine Celtics G League team.
Tatum's Achilles injury status remains unchanged as the Celtics continue to rule him out for each game this season.
Celtics President Brad Stevens stated Tatum will only return when completely ready, having practiced five-on-five scrimmages.

title: Here’s where Mass. finished on the latest list of most educated states
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts ranks as the most educated state in the U.S. in WalletHub's 2026 analysis.
The state leads with over 47% of adults having a bachelor's degree and nearly 22% with advanced degrees.
Vermont and Maryland follow Massachusetts in second and third place; Louisiana, Mississippi, and West Virginia rank lowest.

title: One of the rarest baseball cards is up for auction — and there are local connections
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Honus Wagner T206 card, one of the rarest baseball cards, is up for auction, closing on Feb. 21.
The card was first pulled by Morton Bernstein, a New York child, and kept within his family for 116 years.
Current bid for the card stands at $3.9 million, potentially selling for $4.758 million with buyer's premium.

title: Bruins G Jeremy Swayman set to make Olympic debut and start for Team USA vs. Denmark
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jeremy Swayman will start in goal for Team USA against Denmark at the 2026 Winter Olympics.
Swayman, 27, has been crucial for Team USA in major tournaments, leading them to victory in the 2025 IIHF World Championship.
Bruins defenseman Charlie McAvoy also plays for Team USA, partnering with Quinn Hughes in the team's Olympic opener.

title: New England Aquarium IDs right whale found dead off Virginia
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: New England Aquarium identified a dead North Atlantic right whale on Virginia's coast as a 3-year-old female.
The whale is the 43rd recorded death in the ongoing North Atlantic Right Whale Unusual Mortality Event since 2017.
The female, identified as Porcia's 2023 calf, is the second right whale death in two weeks affecting the small population.

title: Another child has died of the flu in Mass.
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts reports seven pediatric flu deaths this season, contributing to 260 total flu-related fatalities.
Flu activity in Massachusetts peaked in January, heavily impacting hospitals and pediatric care units.
State health officials urge vaccination to combat ongoing flu spread, particularly for vulnerable groups.

title: Mass. police department offers ‘Valentine’s Day Special’ for wanted exes
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Uxbridge Police Department in Massachusetts posts Valentine's Day offering to help residents turn in exes with outstanding warrants.
The department's Facebook post humorously encourages sharing exes' whereabouts, promising a 'Valentine's Day visit' from police.
Other police departments in states like New Hampshire, Ohio, and New York have issued similar holiday-themed warrant reminders.

title: ‘We’ll see how it plays out’: Caleb Durbin, Marcelo Mayer each to practice at 2B, 3B to begin spring training
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Caleb Durbin and Marcelo Mayer to practice at both second and third base as spring training begins.
Red Sox Manager Alex Cora aims to solidify starting infield positions, with a decision expected sooner rather than later.
Boston Red Sox exploring versatile infield options, including Romy Gonzalez and Isiah Kiner-Falefa, for potential platoon scenarios.
